    <metadata>

      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>

            <entry>cahi1:data_103020</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Breaking down limestones</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Brechen hinunter Kalksteine</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Décomposition des calcaires</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Quebrar abaixo pedras calcárias</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Suddivisione dei calcari</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Χωρισμός των ασβεστόλιθων</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Subdivisión de las piedras calizas</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">This illustration shows that limestones can be broken down into its constituents by means of hydrochloric acid.</string>
          </description>
          <language>x-none</language>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">calcium carbonate</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">clay minerals</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">composition</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">hydrochloric acid</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">limestone</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">rocks</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Silica</string>
          </keyword>
          <structure>
            <source>structureValues</source>
            <value>atomic</value>
          </structure>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Diese Abbildung zeigt, daß Kalksteine unten in 
seine Bestandteile mittels der Salzsäure gebrochen werden können.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Cette illustration prouve que des calcaires 
peuvent être décomposés en ses constituants au moyen d'acide 
chlorhydrique.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Esta ilustração mostra que as pedras calcárias
podem ser quebradas para baixo em seus constituents por meio do ácido
hydrochloric.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Questa illustrazione indica che i calcari possono
essere analizzati nei relativi costituenti per mezzo di acido 
cloridrico.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Αυτή η απεικόνιση δείχνει ότι οι ασβεστόλιθοι 
μπορούν να χωριστούν σε τα συστατικά του με τη βοήθεια του 
υδροχλωρικού οξέος.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Esta ilustración muestra que las piedras calizas 
se pueden analizar en sus componentes por medio del ácido 
hidroclórico.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Kalziumkarbonat</string>
          </keyword>
